getParentBlock

public TagAnnot getParentBlock(TokenAnnot ta1,
                               TokenAnnot ta2,
                               int tagType)
Finds the smallest element that contains both the start and end tokens.

getParentBlock

public static TagAnnot getParentBlock(TokenAnnot[] toks,
                                      TokenAnnot ta1,
                                      TokenAnnot ta2,
                                      int tagId,
                                      int tagType,
                                      int startIdx,
                                      int endIdx)
Finds the smallest element that contains both the start and end tokens. Climbs up the tree until it finds a tag which satisfies the given tagId and tagType (set to -1 if you don't care). Specify startIdx and/or endIdx to require the start/end tokens to have specific token indices within the returned tag (set to -1 if you don't care). Set endIdx to Document.LAST_IDX to require the end token to be the last one in the returned tag.

getChildTokenByIdx

public TokenAnnot getChildTokenByIdx(TagAnnot tga,
                                     int idx)
Returns n-th child token within a tag; or null if there is no such token.

getChildTokenIdx

public static int getChildTokenIdx(TokenAnnot[] toks,
                                   TagAnnot tga,
                                   TokenAnnot tok)
Returns the index of the given child token within a containing tag. Returns -1 if the token is not inside the tag.

getRelatedSegments

public int getRelatedSegments(int startIdx,
                              int len,
                              java.util.ArrayList<DocSegment> relatedSegments)
Returns all segments in document which are subordinated to the segment specified by startIdx and len. Typically this is the immediately following segment or, for table headers, all segments in a column or row.

Parameters:
startIdx - start (token index) of the master segment
len - length (in tokens) of the master segment
relatedSegments - list to be filled with subordinated segments
Returns:
count of the added segments

fillCrossTagCounts

public void fillCrossTagCounts(int startIdx,
                               int endIdx,
                               int[] counts)
Fills count array of: [ crossed block tags{0-2}, crossed inline tags{0-2}, 1 if all tokens have the same parent, 0 otherwise, 1 if value fits exactly into parent tag, 0 otherwise ]
